com.bluegosling.collections.queues

Class PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E extends PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bluegosling.collections.queues.PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    P - the type of priority associated with this object
    E - the type of this object
    Enclosing class:
    PriorityQueues

    public abstract class PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E extends PriorityQueues.AutoEntry<P,E>>
extends Object
    A type of value that automatically associates itself with a queue entry when added to a PriorityQueue. This only works when using the object's add(P, com.bluegosling.collections.queues.PriorityQueue<E, P>) method.

    This can be very useful since sophisticated usage of a PriorityQueue requires keeping track of an PriorityQueue.Entry after adding a value to the queue. A common pattern is to store a reference to the associated entry in the actual value, after it is added to the queue. This class encapsulates that pattern.

    To use, extend this class and add fields that represent the actual object/state being added to a queue. Always use the object's add(P, com.bluegosling.collections.queues.PriorityQueue<E, P>) method (instead of using the queue's PriorityQueue.add(E, P) method). This class also provides utility methods for interacting with the queue, like for removing the entry or changing its priority.

    • Method Detail

      • getEntry

        protected PriorityQueue.Entry<E,P> getEntry()
        Gets the element's associated queue entry. This will be null if the object has never been added to a queue.
        Returns:
        the element's associated queue entry

      • add

        public void add(P priority,
                PriorityQueue<E,P> queue)
        Adds this element to the given queue with the given priority. The element can only be associated with one queue at any given time. If the object needs to be added to a different queue, it must first be removed.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority for this object
        queue - the queue into which the object will be added
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the object is already associated with a queue

      • remove

        public void remove()
        Removes the object from the queue that contains it.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this object has never been added to a queue or has already been removed

      • setPriority

        public void setPriority(P priority)
        Changes the priority associated with this object. The priority is initially assigned when the element is added to a queue.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this object has never been added to a queue or has already been removed

      • getPriority

        public P getPriority()
        Gets the priority associated with this object. The priority is initially assigned when the element is added to a queue.
        Returns:
        the priority associated with this object
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this object has never been added to a queue or has already been removed
